description:
The standard ballistic plate issued by the U.S. Army, ESAPI -- Enhanced Small Arms Protective Insert -- is a SAPI-cut ballistic plate with a single-curve profile, composed of a boron carbide strike face and a nylon cover.  This plate has been certified ESAPI, which is comparable with the civilian NIJ IV rating.  Plates like this one are intended to be inserted into a plate carrier, where it will absorb the energy of multiple rifle rounds before requiring replacement.  On the front, it says <color_yellow>
MEDIUM
STRIKE FACE
HANDLE WITH CARE</color>
On the back, it says <color_yellow>
TOP
7.62 mm APM2 PROTECTION
U.S.</color>, as well as the name of the manufacturer -- Ceradyne, Inc. -- and its NSN.
//weight: Wikipedia lists the weight of a medium-sized ESAPI as 5.5 lbs ≈ 2495 g
IOTV technical manual (TM 10-8470-210-10) lists it as 10.9 lbs per pair, or 5.45 lbs ≈ 2472 g per plate
we choose the Army source as likely to be more accurate

notes: while the thickness of these plates does not appear to be uniform between any two batches, we're going to assume an average of 0.8 in. of thickness

damage_verb: makes a crunch, something has shifted

description: This ceramic plate has been taken out of service by the damage it had suffered.  It will no longer provide significant protection against bullets, and should be replaced or thrown away.
